title: Data Center Administrator Job at Unified Payment Services Limited
content:
Unified Payment Services Limited is Nigeria’s premier Payments & Financial Technology company that operates as a shared infrastructure for the banking community in Nigeria and Payments Service Provider within and outside Nigeria, with a vision to be the most preferred e-payment service provider in Africa.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Data Center Administrator

Job Location: Lagos

Job Objectives
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	The DBA will be responsible for the implementation, configuration, maintenance, and performance of critical ORACLE, POSTGRESQL and SQL Server RDBMS systems and in some case, additional database types like MySQL, to ensure the availability and consistent performance of our corporate applications. This is a “hands-on” position requiring solid technical skills, as well as excellent interpersonal and communication skills.
	Staff will be responsible for the development and sustainment of the database and data Warehouse, ensuring its operational readiness (security, health and performance), executing data loads, and performing data modeling in support of multiple development teams. The data warehouse supports an enterprise application suite of program management tools. Must be capable of working independently and collaboratively.


Duties & Responsibilities


	Manage ORACLE, POSTGRESQL and SQL Server databases through multiple product lifecycle environments, from development to mission-critical production systems.
	Configure and maintain database servers and processes, including monitoring of system health and performance, to ensure high levels of performance, availability, and security.
	Apply data modelling techniques to ensure development and implementation support efforts meet integration and performance expectations
	Independently analyze, solve, and correct issues in real time, providing problem resolution end-to-end.
	Refine and automate regular processes, track issues, and document changes
	Assist developers with complex query tuning and schema refinement.
	Provide 24x7 support for critical production systems.
	Perform scheduled maintenance and support release deployment activities after hours.
	Share domain and technical expertise, providing technical mentorship and cross-training to other peers and team members.


Job Requirements
Qualifications:


	A minimum of Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science or its equivalent (Higher Dip./B.Eng/B.Tech/BSc. in Computer Science/Information Technology
	Experience: 2-6 years of post NYSC experience.


Key Competencies:


	Good knowledge of ORACLE, POSTGRESQL and MS SQL Server Administration experience required.
	Experience with Performance Tuning and Optimization (PTO), using native monitoring and troubleshooting tools.
	Experience with backups, restores and recovery models.
	Knowledge of High Availability (HA) and Disaster Recovery (DR) options for SQL Server.
	Knowledge of Oracle data guard technology and role switching operations.
	Knowledge of PostgreSQL replication and failover process data guard technology and role switching operations.
	Experience working with Windows server, including Active Directory.
	Experience working with Oracle Linux operating system.
	Excellent written and verbal communication.
	Flexible, team player, “get-it-done” personality.
	Ability to organize and plan work independently.
	Ability to work in a rapidly changing environment.
	Ability to multi-task and context-switch effectively between different activities and teams.
	Good knowledge of scripting.
	Basic knowledge of storage and its operation ability.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: ademuyiwa.adetunji@up-ng.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

title: Group General Manager Job at Portrec Resourcing
content:
Portrec Resourcing is one of Nigria's top leading recruitment and HR consulting firm. A hub where recruiters meets their ideal talents to ensure somooth and healthy labour force. Portrec has helped organizations across various industries to recruit and hire skilledtalents helping businesses and organizations thrive on all front.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Group General Manager

Job Location: Ikeja, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Key Responsibilities
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Oversee the daily operations across both companies, ensuring alignment with strategic goals.
	Develop and implement scalable operational processes and policies to support growth.
	Lead and coordinate cross-functional teams including IT service, project delivery, sales, and business development.
	Lead recruitment, onboarding, and training processes in coordination with HR.
	Drive process improvements, risk management, and business continuity initiatives.
	Collaborate with the senior leadership team to translate strategic objectives into executable operational plans.
	Ensure that all client projects, support services, and internal operations are delivered on time, within budget, and to a high standard.
	Monitor performance through KPIs, dashboards, and reporting tools.
	Support the integration and usage of digital tools and platforms (CRM, Service Desk, ERP).
	Serve as a key escalation point for critical issues and service failures.
	Ensure regulatory, compliance, and contractual obligations are met in both regions.


Required Skills & Experience


	5+ years of experience in a senior operations leadership role, preferably within the IT or Tech services sector.
	Strong track record of managing distributed teams and multi-country operations.
	Deep understanding of IT service management (ITSM), CRM systems, and workflow automation platforms.
	Excellent analytical, planning, and reporting abilities.
	Skilled in SharePoint, Microsoft Teams, GoHighLevel, Jira, or similar platforms.
	Exceptional interpersonal, communication, and negotiation skills.
	Experience working in start-up or growth environments is highly desirable.
	Knowledge of both UK and Nigerian business cultures and operational environments is an added advantage.
	Ability to work flexible hours, including evenings and weekends when necessary.


Core Attributes:


	Strategic thinker with the ability to execute tactically
	Self-starter with a high level of initiative
	Calm under pressure and solutions-oriented
	Strong leadership presence and emotional intelligence
	A passion for improving systems and developing team.


Why Work with Us?


	Salary: N7,500,000 Annually
	You’ll be joining two ambitious companies with a shared vision for impact, innovation, and international growth.
	We offer an empowering environment where you’ll directly influence how we scale and succeed.
	You’ll work closely with visionary leadership and have a seat at the table.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV in PDF to: jobs@portrec.ng using the Job Positoin as the subject of the mail.

title: Flutter Developer Job at Elizabeth Maddeux LImited
content:
Elizabeth Maddeux LImited provides a range of human resources solutions designed to empower your workforce, enhance technical proficiency, refine soft skills, and accelerateorganizational growth for better impacts by enhancing organizational dynamics through a well-rounded and robust human resource intervention.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Flutter Developer
Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	We are seeking a highly motivated and skilled Flutter Developer to join our client’s technology team, a leading financial service provider.
	In this role, you will be responsible for developing and maintaining secure, scalable, and high-performance mobile applications that support the digital financial services.
	You will play a critical role in improving the customers' mobile banking experience.


Responsibilities


	Design and build advanced cross-platform mobile applications using Flutter.
	Collaborate with cross-functional teams (product, design, backend, QA) to define, design, and ship new features.
	Translate UI/UX designs into functional and visually appealing mobile interfaces.
	Integrate mobile apps with APIs, payment gateways, and internal banking systems.
	Ensure the security of financial transactions and sensitive customer data through encryption and secure coding practices.
	Conduct unit, integration, and user acceptance testing to ensure the app meets business requirements.
	Monitor app performance and troubleshoot issues across different devices and platforms.
	Optimize application performance, responsiveness, and battery usage.
	Maintain documentation for app features, architecture, and technical decisions.
	Mentor junior developers or interns (if applicable), and contribute to the knowledge-sharing culture within the tech team.
	Research new technologies and recommend improvements to enhance app functionality and user experience.
	Participate in sprint planning, standups, and reviews as part of an Agile development team.
	Ensure compliance with regulatory and banking standards in app functionality and data handling.
	Provide post-release support, updates, and enhancements as required.
	Strong understanding of mobile app architecture and state management (e.g., Provider, Bloc, Riverpod).
	Familiarity with RESTful APIs, JSON, and mobile UI/UX design principles.
	Experience with Firebase, SQLite, or other mobile databases.
	Familiar with version control tools like Git and deployment to Google Play and Apple App Store.
	Knowledge of security protocols, data protection, and compliance in financial applications is an added advantage.


Requirements


	Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or a related field (or equivalent experience).
	Minimum of 3 - 4 years of hands-on experience in mobile application development using Flutter.
	Strong knowledge of Dart programming language and Flutter SDK.
	Proven experience with integrating RESTful APIs and third-party libraries
	Experience with CI/CD tools for automated build and deployment.
	Ability to debug performance bottlenecks and optimize for speed, responsiveness.
	Solid understanding of mobile application architecture and state management.
	Proximity to the location.


Salary
N400,000 - N450,000 / Month.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: careers@elizabethmaddeux.com using “Flutter Developer" as the subject of the email.

title: Land Property Investigation Officer Job at Nine Stars Limited
content:
At nine stars limited, weprovide an industrial platform to foster sustainable growth across Africa through diverse rangeofservices. From agriculture to real estate, Energy and mining to hospitality and security we bring sustainable innovation and excellence to every sector we touch. Our mission is to leverage innovation and sustainability to create lasting value in Agriculture, Energy, Mining, Real estate, Hospitality and Security while maintaining cordial relationship amongst our Clients, host Communities and Government.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Land Property Investigation Officer

Job Location: Ode-Remo, Ogun
Employment Type: Full-time
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    



Job Summary


	We are seeking a detail-oriented and highly analytical Land Property Investigation Officer to join our team. 
	The successful candidate will be responsible for conducting thorough investigations into land ownership, title verification, boundary disputes, illegal encroachments, and other land-related issues.
	This role is vital in ensuring lawful land transactions, resolving disputes, and upholding property rights in accordance with relevant laws and regulations.


Key Responsibilities


	Investigate and verify land ownership claims, titles, and historical records.
	Conduct field inspections and site visits to assess and gather relevant data on land parcels.
	Collect and analyze land documentation, including deeds, cadastral maps, lease agreements, and survey plans.
	Maintain accurate and organized records of all investigations and case files.
	Identify and document instances of land encroachment, fraud, illegal occupation, or boundary disputes.
	Collaborate with legal teams, surveyors, and relevant government agencies to resolve land disputes.
	Prepare comprehensive investigation reports, findings, and recommendations for internal and legal use.
	Attend court sessions, tribunals, or dispute resolution meetings when required, serving as an expert witness if necessary.
	Provide guidance on land compliance issues and contribute to the development of land management policies.
	Support the digitization and modernization of land records where applicable.


Requirements and Qualifications
Education & Experience:


	Bachelor’s Degree in Land Management, Law, Surveying, Real Estate, Geography, Urban Planning, or a related field.
	3 - 5 years of relevant experience in land investigations, land administration, or a similar role.
	Experience working with government land registries, survey offices, or legal institutions is an added advantage.


Skills & Competencies:


	Strong knowledge of land laws, property rights, registration processes, and dispute resolution.
	Proficiency in reading and interpreting land maps, cadastral plans, and legal documents.
	Excellent analytical, investigative, and problem-solving skills.
	Strong communication skills (both verbal and written) with the ability to produce detailed reports.
	High level of integrity, discretion, and ethical conduct.
	Ability to work independently and under pressure, with good time management.
	Familiarity with GIS and land record systems is a plus.
	Understand and interact in the indigenous language (Yoruba)


Salary
N150,000 - N400,000 monthly.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their Resume to: ninestars.recruitment@yahoo.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

Note: For more inquiries, Call: 08167711717, WhatsApp: 08135113490.

title: Civil Engineer Job at Nine Stars Limited
content:
Nine Stars Limited is a dynamic and innovative agricultural and real estate company committed to transforming Nigeria’s real estate market landscape. Based in Ode-Remo, Sagamu in Ogun State, our company aims to provide unparalleled real estate solutions, offering a wide range of services that cater to the diverse needs of individuals and businesses alike.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Civil Engineer
Job Location: Ode-Remo, Ogun
Employment Type: Full-time

Position Summary
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	The Civil Engineer will oversee and manage all civil engineering aspects of building construction projects, from concept through completion. The ideal candidate will bring a wealth of experience in erecting various building types across multiple stages, from foundation to finish.
	A key part of the role will involve the accurate interpretation of architectural and structural drawings, coordination with contractors, and leading on-site teams to deliver projects safely, on time, and within budget.


Key Responsibilities


	Project Oversight: Lead and supervise construction activities across various sites, ensuring compliance with structural and architectural designs, specifications, and timelines.
	Drawing Interpretation: Accurately interpret and implement architectural, structural, and MEP drawings and ensure alignment with construction execution on-site.
	Construction Management: Oversee the erection of different types of buildings including residential estates, high-rise towers, commercial complexes, and mixed-use developments.
	Site Leadership: Provide strong leadership to site supervisors, foremen, and laborers; allocate tasks effectively and ensure optimal team performance.
	Quality Assurance: Enforce rigorous quality control procedures and monitor construction standards to ensure delivery of top-tier developments.
	Vendor/Contractor Coordination: Liaise with subcontractors, suppliers, consultants, and government authorities to facilitate smooth project execution.
	Problem Solving: Proactively identify and resolve site issues, engineering challenges, and project delays with practical, cost-effective solutions.
	Budget & Resource Management: Work closely with the project manager and QS team to monitor project budgets, timelines, and resource allocations.
	Health & Safety Compliance: Ensure that all on-site activities adhere strictly to health and safety standards, building codes, and environmental regulations.
	Reporting: Provide regular project progress reports, site logs, and technical documentation to management and stakeholders.


Requirements


	Education: Bachelor’s degree in Civil Engineering or related field
	Experience: 5–10 years in building construction with proven experience in real estate development or construction companies.
	Professional Certification: COREN registration required; PMP or relevant construction certifications are an advantage.
	Leadership: Demonstrated ability to lead large teams on complex projects with excellent people management and coordination skills.
	Analytical Skills: Strong problem-solving, critical thinking, and decision-making abilities.
	Communication: Excellent verbal and written communication skills; able to collaborate effectively across disciplines.
	Adaptability: Must be willing to work in dynamic environments and be flexible with working hours as project needs dictate.


Technical Proficiency:


	Strong knowledge of construction methods, materials, and legal regulations.
	Proficiency in AutoCAD, Revit, Civil 3D, MS Project, and other relevant engineering software.


Salary
N200,000 - N600,000 monthly.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their Resume to: ninestars.recruitment@yahoo.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

Note: For more information call: 08167711717 or WhatsApp: 08135113490.
